alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Elmore and central Tallapoosa Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 641 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eastern Lake Martin, or 9 miles southwest of Dadeville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dadeville, Camp Hill, Waverly, Eastern Lake Martin, Liberty City, Southern Lake Martin, Kowaliga Bridge, Still Waters Resort, Martin Dam, Western Lake Martin, Northern Lake Martin, Susannah Crossing, Maxwell Gunter Recreation Area, Blue Creek Marina, Dare Park and Reeltown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Martin, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for east central Alabama.
